attributes.action: Make pathological demand avoidance, a form of autism. Recognised nationwide
attributes.additional_details:
My son has been seen by 7 doctors at CAMHS and Art therapist. Over 10 years we finally received a diagnosis of pda 2 years ago by a Doctor who has since left. 
I am left with no other supporting, professional at Camhs, as nhs trust do not believe in pda being a form of autism. 
More information on pda can be found on NAS, PDA Society, Elizabeth Newson Clinic. 
I will be meeting with our local mp Ben Gummer in the next couple of weeks. Please support us to get Joey and others the support!
attributes.background:
Children like my eldest son who have been diagnosed with Pda, which is a recognised form of autism by the NAS, it is a daily struggle, anxiety led behavioural problems.
It is not fully recognised through the NHS so no support available for education, or family.

rejection.details:
The UK Government or Parliament are not responsible for recognising or classifying disorders and health-related problems. The World Health Organisation or the American Psychiatric Association are responsible for recognising pathological demand avoidance as a distinct health issue.  

You could start a new petition asking the UK Government or Parliament to fund more research into pathological demand avoidance. You could also start a new petition asking the UK Government or Parliament to provide more funding so that children like Joey can access more support.
